messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Mnemonic Device for remembering names + old scan
messages.msgSnippet: I think that the uniform s more like a general style of black shirts that spies wear...not an actual, official, uniform , which would totally defeat the
messages.messageBody:
I think that the uniform's more like a general style of black shirts that spies wear...not an actual, official, uniform , which would totally defeat the purpose of being/having spies...rofl...it's more for camouflage, i would think ^^, than to be identified as a spy when they wear it.

secretary <secretarytocapt3@...> wrote:
Thank you to those who have attempted to translate the caption beneath
the shirt. Our member, [Tama], provided a clarification saying that
it is in fact Koga TAnji's shirt. Koga was a friend of Fujita Goro in
the TMPD where they both worked as spies. Fujita Goro would have worn
a similar shirt and nobekama (not sure about the spelling).

http://1happyturtle.com/makoto/SHclothes.jpg

now the question is why would a spy "uniform" exist *_* wouldn't that
be dangerous? ^_^

secretarytocapt3
AIM badgerturtle

messages.subject: Re: Mnemonic Device for remembering names + old scan
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you to those who have attempted to translate the caption beneath the shirt.  Our member, [Tama], provided a clarification saying that it is in fact Koga
messages.messageBody:
Thank you to those who have attempted to translate the caption beneath
the shirt. Our member, [Tama], provided a clarification saying that
it is in fact Koga TAnji's shirt. Koga was a friend of Fujita Goro in
the TMPD where they both worked as spies. Fujita Goro would have worn
a similar shirt and nobekama (not sure about the spelling).

http://1happyturtle.com/makoto/SHclothes.jpg

now the question is why would a spy "uniform" exist *_* wouldn't that
be dangerous? ^_^

secretarytocapt3
AIM badgerturtle

messages.subject: RE: [SHQ] Mnemonic Device for remembering names + old scan
messages.msgSnippet: Ummm... I can only read the kanji below the shirt... so it s really rough & incomplete  translation .
messages.messageBody:
Ummm... I can only read the kanji below the shirt... so it's really rough & incomplete translation >.<
It basically says:
Ancient brave/risk ... spy/secret use ... soldier uniform. top bottom ... (........made). West south war times [some guy's name... translates to Sai (as in Saitoh) Field (that one character in Okita) Five ... (I think the last character is like...gentleman or something, I dunno what it is in English)] and/together ... wear ...... ....... (bottom) ... black color wild sleeve style. <--no idea what that's supposed to mean >.<
Uhh, if u could get ANYTHING from that... rofl, i truly respect ur skills... XD XD XD

Hirotada Tokugawa <patriot014@...> wrote:
>http://1happyturtle.com/makoto/SHclothes.jpg
>*if anyone knows what the text beneath the image says please share
>

It's a French shirt of some sort that he wore in the Seinan-- the same shirt
he had on when he met Sano in RK.

>http://1happyturtle.com/makoto/SH5mystery.jpg (click to ZOOM)

It's right next to the tsuba, so it might be a teacup....

---M.
